original: lha dang gcig tu gol ba'i gnas //

original: gang phyir kun mkhyen tshad mas yin //

original: gus pas kun mkhyen 'gyur ba min //

translated: Respect does not become omniscience.üîΩEven though it was done by the Victorious One, it was not done,

analyzed: rgyal bas mdzad kyang ma mdzad dang // des ma gsung la des gsungs smra //

original: 'gro mchog mi slu bde gshegs la //
analyzed: 'gro mchog mi slu bde gshegs la //
translated: The supreme being, the non-deceptive Sugata,

analyzed: gnyis ga gzhogs 'phyas byed par mtshungs //
translated: Is the same as one who slanders both.

original: rgyal bas phan pa du ma gsungs //
analyzed: rgyal bas phan pa du ma gsungs //
translated: The Victorious One spoke of many benefits,

original: skye bo bsam pa ji bzhin len //
analyzed: skye bo bsam pa ji bzhin len //
translated: And people take it according to their thoughts.

original: de ltar 'grel 'dir don bshad la'ang //
analyzed: de ltar 'grel 'dir don bshad la'ang //
translated: Thus, in this commentary, the meaning is explained,

original: 'dod pas 'jug par byed pa yin ;üîΩ; rtogs pa med na thos pa min //
analyzed: 'dod pas 'jug par byed pa yin ; ; rtogs pa med na thos pa min //
translated: And one should engage with it out of desire.üîΩIf there is no realization, there is no hearing.

original: thos pa med na bsam du med //
analyzed: thos pa med na bsam du med //
translated: If there is no hearing, there is nothing to contemplate.

original: gnyis ka nyams pas rnal 'byor med //
analyzed: gnyis ka nyams pas rnal 'byor med //
translated: If both are lost, there is no yoga.

original: rnal 'byor med na 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rnal 'byor med na 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: If there is no yoga, there will be no accomplishment.

original: 'di ltar rgyud 'dir yun ring nas //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyud 'dir yun ring nas //
translated: Thus, for a long time in this tantra,

original: 'dod pa yis ni rab gdungs pa'i //
analyzed: 'dod pa yis ni rab gdungs pa'i //
translated: The one who is tormented by desireüîΩShould be robbed by this

original: snying la mu tig phreng bar ni //üîΩbrgyus pa 'di yis phrogs shig go //
analyzed: snying la mu tig phreng bar ni //üîΩbrgyus pa 'di yis phrogs shig go //
translated: String of pearls in the heart.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gleng gzhi'i tshig ni kha cig na re gang gi phyir mdor bsdus pa rgyud gzhan nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gleng gzhi'i tshig ni kha cig na re gang gi phyir mdor bsdus pa rgyud gzhan nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The words of the nidana, Thus have I heard, etc., are said by some to be a summary of the Mahayoga Tantra, because it is a different continuum.

original: gzhan dag na re rgyud chen po las rtog pa gnyis pa 'di btus te //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rgyud chen po las rtog pa gnyis pa 'di btus te //
translated: Others say that this second Tantra is a summary of the Great Tantra,

original: der ji lta ba bzhin du bsdus te bzhag pa nyid 'dir gleng gzhi'i tshig dang bcas te bsdus pa'o zhes zer ro //üîΩgzhan ni 'di gsang chen mchog gi don gzhan yin no //
analyzed: der ji lta ba bzhin du bsdus te bzhag pa nyid 'dir gleng gzhi'i tshig dang bcas te bsdus pa'o zhes zer ro // gzhan ni 'di gsang chen mchog gi don gzhan yin no //
translated: and that it is summarized here with the words of the nidana, just as it was summarized there.

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is a different meaning of the Supreme Secret.

original: de ni yang dag pa yin te //
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa yin te //
translated: That is correct.

original: de dang por brjod pa mi rigs pa dang / 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ba nyid dang yi ge yin pa la brten pa nyid de /
analyzed: de dang por brjod pa mi rigs pa dang / 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ba nyid dang yi ge yin pa la brten pa nyid de /
translated: It is not reasonable to state it at the beginning, and it will be explained below that it is based on the letters.

original: des na 'chad par 'gyur ba don gzhan la don gzhan gyis sbyor bar byed @221b pa ni rmongs pa rnams ngo mtshar bskyed pa'i don to //
analyzed: des na 'chad par 'gyur ba don gzhan la don gzhan gyis sbyor bar byed @221b pa ni rmongs pa rnams ngo mtshar bskyed pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the application of one meaning to another meaning is for the purpose of generating wonder in the ignorant.

original: de bas na dang po'i gleng gzhi'i tshig 'di yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bas na dang po'i gleng gzhi'i tshig 'di yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, this statement of the introductory section is also spoken by the Lord.

original: dge slong dag nga'i chos rnams ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bsdu bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag nga'i chos rnams ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bsdu bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Bhikshus, my teachings should be collected with the words Thus have I heard.

original: de bas na sdud par byed pas smras pa /
analyzed: de bas na sdud par byed pas smras pa /
translated: Therefore, the compiler says, Thus have I heard.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes so //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes so //
translated: This is because he says, Thus have I heard.

original: rang gis thos par rtogs nas chos ston par byed la /
analyzed: rang gis thos par rtogs nas chos ston par byed la /
translated: Having understood what he himself heard, he teaches the Dharma.

original: ston pa po las thos nas sdud par byed de /
analyzed: ston pa po las thos nas sdud par byed de /
translated: Having heard it from the Teacher, he compiles it.

original: de bas na thos pa zhes bya ba 'dis sdud pa por bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na thos pa zhes bya ba 'dis sdud pa por bstan to //
translated: Therefore, by the word heard, he shows that he is the compiler.

original: mngon gsum du ma thos pa dang / rnam pa gzhan du thos na sdud pa po tshad ma ma yin pa dang / 'gyur bas de gnyis gsal ba'i phyir 'di skad bdag gis zhes tshig gnyis smos so //
analyzed: mngon gsum du ma thos pa dang / rnam pa gzhan du thos na sdud pa po tshad ma ma yin pa dang / 'gyur bas de gnyis gsal ba'i phyir 'di skad bdag gis zhes tshig gnyis smos so //
translated: If he had not heard it directly, or if he had heard it in a different way, he would not be a valid compiler, and he would change it. In order to clarify these two, he says the two words Thus have I heard.

original: de la bdag gis zhes pa ni bdag gis ston pa po nyid las thos pa yin gyi thos pa gzhan dang gzhan las 'ongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdag gis zhes pa ni bdag gis ston pa po nyid las thos pa yin gyi thos pa gzhan dang gzhan las 'ongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: In that regard, by me means that it was heard from the teacher himself, and not from other sources.

original: 'di skad ces pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du sdud par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di skad ces pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du sdud par byed pa ste /
translated: The phrase thus have I heard means that it was compiled as it is.

original: 'di kho na skad bdag gis thos kyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di kho na skad bdag gis thos kyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means I have heard it in this way, and not otherwise.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i gnas su res 'ga' ston pa po bzhugs pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i 'khor 'dus pa ston pas de'i gleng gzhi gsungs pa dus gcig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i gnas su res 'ga' ston pa po bzhugs pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i 'khor 'dus pa ston pas de'i gleng gzhi gsungs pa dus gcig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The setting is taught by the statement at one time, etc., which is the introduction to the text, since the teacher sometimes resides in a suitable place, and the suitable assembly gathers.

original: dus gcig ni dus 'ga' zhig na'o //
analyzed: dus gcig ni dus 'ga' zhig na'o //
translated: At one time means at some time.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i sku can gyi rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i sku can gyi rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One refers to Vajradhara, the possessor of the body of Hevajra.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa drug dang ldan pas bcom pa ste /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa drug dang ldan pas bcom pa ste /
translated: He is blessed because he is endowed with the six qualities of mastery, etc.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang / dpal dang grags dang ye shes dang // brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs ldan dang // drug po 'di la bcom zhes bya //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //üîΩbcom pa de 'di la yod pas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang / dpal dang grags dang ye shes dang // brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs ldan dang // drug po 'di la bcom zhes bya // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o // bcom pa de 'di la yod pas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The conqueror is one who has conquered the six perfections, or else, the six perfections are called the conqueror because they conquer poverty, because they conquer the world, and because they conquer the two veils.

original: bzhugs zhes pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis gnas pa bzhugs pa'o //üîΩsangs rgyas rnams kyis gnas pa yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: bzhugs zhes pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis gnas pa bzhugs pa'o // sangs rgyas rnams kyis gnas pa yang bzhi ste /
translated: The word abides means that the buddhas abide in the fourfold abiding.

original: spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa dang chos ston pas bzhugs pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pas bzhugs pa dang nang du yang dag 'jog pas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa dang chos ston pas bzhugs pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pas bzhugs pa dang nang du yang dag 'jog pas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The fourfold abiding of the buddhas is abiding in the perfections, abiding in teaching the Dharma, abiding in meditative concentration, and abiding in the inner principle.

original: kun tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i rgyu ni bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: kun tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i rgyu ni bzhugs pa ste /
translated: The cause of abiding in meditative concentration is the perfection of meditative development.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'o //üîΩde'i phyir cung zad sangs rgyas bcom ldan @222a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'o //üîΩde'i phyir cung zad sangs rgyas bcom ldan @222a * //
translated: The word always means that the buddhas are always in meditative concentration.üîΩThe word abides means that the buddhas abide in the fourfold abiding.

original: 'das rnams kyi sku'i phrin las de dang de rnams ni spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'das rnams kyi sku'i phrin las de dang de rnams ni spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The deeds of body of those Buddhas are the deeds of abiding in the postures.

original: gang cung zad de rnams kyi gsung gi phrin las de ni chos ston pas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang cung zad de rnams kyi gsung gi phrin las de ni chos ston pas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The deeds of speech of those Buddhas are the deeds of abiding in teaching the Dharma.

original: gang de rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'am tha mal pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i thugs kyi phrin las ni snyoms par 'jug pas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang de rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'am tha mal pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i thugs kyi phrin las ni snyoms par 'jug pas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The deeds of mind of those Buddhas are the deeds of abiding in meditative equipoise, whether in meditative equipoise in a meditative stabilization or in ordinary meditative equipoise.

original: gang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dang / lha la sogs pa nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir thugs kyi phrin las de dang de rnams ni nang du yang dag 'jog pa la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dang / lha la sogs pa nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir thugs kyi phrin las de dang de rnams ni nang du yang dag 'jog pa la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The deeds of mind of those Buddhas are the deeds of abiding in internal meditative equipoise, for the sake of abiding in bliss in this life and for the sake of attracting gods and so forth.

original: gang du bzhugs she na /üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje la'o //
analyzed: gang du bzhugs she na / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje la'o //
translated: Where do they abide?üîΩThey abide in the vajra body, speech, and mind of all Ones Gone Thus.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs ni gsang ba gsum bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs ni gsang ba gsum bsdus pa ste /
translated: The body, speech, and mind of all Ones Gone Thus are the collection of the three secrets.

original: 'di sku yang yin la gsung dang thugs kyang yin pas de skad ces bya la /
analyzed: 'di sku yang yin la gsung dang thugs kyang yin pas de skad ces bya la /
translated: It is called that because it is a body, and also a speech and a mind.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin chos kyi 'byung gnas so //
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin chos kyi 'byung gnas so //
translated: Moreover, it is a source of phenomena, the nature of the Blessed One, the Vajra Holder.

original: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba rnams kyi shin tu dag pa de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba rnams kyi shin tu dag pa de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the very purity of the secrets of the Tathagatas, the nature of suchness.

original: gang gi phyir gsang ba gsum bsdus pa de'i phyir gru gsum mo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsang ba gsum bsdus pa de'i phyir gru gsum mo //
translated: It is a triangle because it is a collection of the three secrets.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis ston gyi zla ba ltar dkar la nang stong pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyis ston gyi zla ba ltar dkar la nang stong pa'o //
translated: It is white like the autumn moon, and hollow inside, because of its very pure suchness.

original: gang gi phyir gong nas gong du yangs pa ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i rim pas rnam par dag pa de'i phyir gong nas gong du yangs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gong nas gong du yangs pa ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i rim pas rnam par dag pa de'i phyir gong nas gong du yangs pa'o //
translated: It is wider and wider because of its purity by the stages of the Joyous and so forth.

original: de nyid rdo rje btsun mo spyan la sogs pa'i bha ga ste /
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje btsun mo spyan la sogs pa'i bha ga ste /
translated: It is the bhaga of the Vajra Queen, Locana, and so forth,

original: de rnams kyi bha ga ni zag pa med pa mtha' yas pa'i chos rnams kyi lus yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bha ga ni zag pa med pa mtha' yas pa'i chos rnams kyi lus yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the body of the infinite, undefiled dharmas.

original: de nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyang de yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyang de yin la /
translated: That is the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas.

original: rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga yang de yin pas de skad ces bya ste khyab par bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga yang de yin pas de skad ces bya ste khyab par bsdu ba'o //
translated: And that is also the bhaga of the Vajra Queen.

original: de rnams la zhes pa ni gzhal yas khang der zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams la zhes pa ni gzhal yas khang der zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase in those means in that celestial mansion.

original: dper na grong khyer na khyim bdag gnas so zhes byas na grong khyer gyi khang bzangs su gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dper na grong khyer na khyim bdag gnas so zhes byas na grong khyer gyi khang bzangs su gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For example, if one says, The householder lives in the city, it means that he lives in a house in the city.

original: gsang zhing chos gsang ba'i gnas der bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa mthong nas nges par der bcom ldan 'das gsang zhing mchog tu gsang ba'i chos ston par 'gyur bas rjes su mthun pa'i 'khor 'dus pa ni shugs kyis gsungs pa @222b yin te ;
analyzed: gsang zhing chos gsang ba'i gnas der bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa mthong nas nges par der bcom ldan 'das gsang zhing mchog tu gsang ba'i chos ston par 'gyur bas rjes su mthun pa'i 'khor 'dus pa ni shugs kyis gsungs pa @222b yin te ;
translated: Having seen the Bhagavan dwelling in that secret place of secret Dharma, it is implicitly stated that the concordant retinue gathered there, thinking, The Bhagavan will definitely teach the secret, supreme Dharma there,

original: de yang 'khor byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje snying po la sogs pa dang / spyan la sogs pa dang / goo ri la sogs pa rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams so //
analyzed: de yang 'khor byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje snying po la sogs pa dang / spyan la sogs pa dang / goo ri la sogs pa rdo rje rnal 'byor ma rnams so //
translated: The retinue is the bodhisattvas Vajragarbha and so forth, Locana and so forth, and the Vajrayoginis Gauri and so forth.

original: der zhes pa ni der bzhugs na'o //
analyzed: der zhes pa ni der bzhugs na'o //
translated: There means there in the retinue.

original: bka' stsal pa zhes pa su'i don du bka' stsal zhe na /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa zhes pa su'i don du bka' stsal zhe na /
translated: The statement spoke means spoke for the sake of whom?

original: skye bo nyan 'dod pas gdungs pa rnams kyi don du'o //
analyzed: skye bo nyan 'dod pas gdungs pa rnams kyi don du'o //
translated: For the sake of those who are tormented by the desire to hear.

original: ci bka' stsal zhe na /
analyzed: ci bka' stsal zhe na /
translated: What did he say?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: All the Tathagatas, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ji srid bgrod par bya ba de srid du gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ji srid bgrod par bya ba de srid du gshegs pa ste /
translated: A Tathagata is one who has gone thus to the end of what is to be gone,

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'o //
translated: having abandoned all obscurations together with their traces.

original: yang na gshegs pa'i sgra ni mkhyen pa'i don te /
analyzed: yang na gshegs pa'i sgra ni mkhyen pa'i don te /
translated: Alternatively, the word gone means to know,

original: chos nyid ji lta ba de bzhin nyid du mkhyen pas 'di rnams de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: chos nyid ji lta ba de bzhin nyid du mkhyen pas 'di rnams de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: and these are Tathagatas because they know reality just as it is.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du shes bya thams cad yang dag par mkhyen pa'o //

original: bsam pa dang rigs dang gdul bya ji lta ba dang dus ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i chos ston par mdzad de thams cad kyang de yin la de bzhin gshegs pa yang de yin te /

original: de rnams kyi sku gsung thugs de nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sku gsung thugs de nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //

original: de'i snying po ni dam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i snying po ni dam pa'o //

original: rje btsun zhes bya ba ni mchog gi lha ste ;
analyzed: rje btsun zhes bya ba ni mchog gi lha ste ;

original: spros pa med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid sngags kyi lha rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs thams cad kyi snying po ni mchog tu dad par dka' ba nyid do //

original: de rnams kyi shin tu gsang ba ni gsang ba las shin tu gsang ba nyid de /
analyzed: de rnams kyi shin tu gsang ba ni gsang ba las shin tu gsang ba nyid de /

original: gnyen po des kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la bsags pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi bag la nyal yongs su zad nas /
analyzed: gnyen po des kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la bsags pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi bag la nyal yongs su zad nas /

original: gnas dang lus dang longs spyod du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa rnams 'gags nas de kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid dor nas zag pa med pa'i dbyings kyi mtshan nyid yongs su 'dzin to //

translated: The consciousnesses that appear as the place, body, and enjoyments cease, and they take on the character of the uncontaminated realm, having abandoned the character of the consciousness of the ground of all.

analyzed: de thob pa na de ltar brten nas long spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku 'thob po zhes bya ba grub pa'i mtha' //

analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid sangs rgyas nyid kyi phyir bsgom par bya ste /

analyzed: gnyis kyis rnam pa brdzun pa rnams nub cing mtha' yas pa gsal ba tsam du snang pa'o ;

analyzed: ; de ltar na gang dag he ru ka dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi rnam pa dang bcas pa'i sngags dang mtshan ma dang gdan dang gzhal yas khang la sogs pa bsgom pa ni spros pa dang bcas shing phyin ci log yin pas te nyon mongs pa'i 'khor ba 'byung ba ste /

original: de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /

analyzed: dril bu zhes pa ni rdo rje'i dril bu'o //

original: snyoms par 'jug pa zhes pa ni des gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa zhes pa ni des gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //

original: g-yas pa dang g-yon pa na gri gug dang thod pa zhes pa ni dgyes pa'i rdo rje la 'khyud pa'i shes rab ma'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa dang g-yon pa na gri gug dang thod pa zhes pa ni dgyes pa'i rdo rje la 'khyud pa'i shes rab ma'o //

original: kha cig na re phyag gnyis ma'i shes rab ma ni g-yung mo yin pas des 'khyud pas so //
analyzed: kha cig na re phyag gnyis ma'i shes rab ma ni g-yung mo yin pas des 'khyud pas so //

original: zhes sngar bstan pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes sngar bstan pa nyid do zhes zer ro //

original: yang dag ni rgyud 'di la mchod pa'i lha mo g-yung mo ste phyag gnyis pa'i yang btsun mo ni bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: yang dag ni rgyud 'di la mchod pa'i lha mo g-yung mo ste phyag gnyis pa'i yang btsun mo ni bdag med ma'o //
translated: The true is the goddess of worship in this tantra, the eternal girl, and the noble lady is NairƒÅtmya.

original: dkyil 'khor gdon pa'i le'u las phyag bcu drug pa'i de nyid bstan te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gdon pa'i le'u las phyag bcu drug pa'i de nyid bstan te /

original: phyag gnyis pa la yang de'i dmigs kyis dbye ba ma gsungs pas so //
analyzed: phyag gnyis pa la yang de'i dmigs kyis dbye ba ma gsungs pas so //

analyzed: khams gsum bdag med pa'i phyag rgya ni ro'o //

analyzed: ro de mnan pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis khams gsum ro mnan pa'o //

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje dka' 'grel mu tig phreng ba las le'u gsum pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rje dka' 'grel mu tig phreng ba las le'u gsum pa'i bshad pa'o /

original: // / lha dbang skur ba'i le'u zhes pa la lha ni dgyes pa'i rdo rje la sogs pa sngar gsungs pa las gang yang rung ba rim gyis bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: // / lha dbang skur ba'i le'u zhes pa la lha ni dgyes pa'i rdo rje la sogs pa sngar gsungs pa las gang yang rung ba rim gyis bskyed pa'o //

analyzed: de'i dbang bskur ba ni ye shes kyi chus bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad 'khru ba'o //

original: de gsal bar byed pa'i le'u dang / rang gi snying gar sa bon zhes pa ni lha'i gzugs su bskyed pa de'i bdag nyid kyi sa bon gang nyi ma la gnas pa'am nyi ma'i rdo rje la gnas pa dang / zla ba la gnas pa'am zla ba'i mtshan ma la gnas pa ji ltar rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de gsal bar byed pa'i le'u dang / rang gi snying gar sa bon zhes pa ni lha'i gzugs su bskyed pa de'i bdag nyid kyi sa bon gang nyi ma la gnas pa'am nyi ma'i rdo rje la gnas pa dang / zla ba la gnas pa'am zla ba'i mtshan ma la gnas pa ji ltar rigs pa'o //
translated: The chapter that clarifies that, and the seed in one's heart, is the seed of the nature of the deity generated, which is located on the sun or on the sun-vajra, or located on the moon or on the moon-sign, as appropriate.

original: nag po 'bar ba zhes pa ni dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: nag po 'bar ba zhes pa ni dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i phyogs la'o //

original: lha mo rnams la ni ci rigs par ro //
analyzed: lha mo rnams la ni ci rigs par ro //
translated: For the goddesses, it is as appropriate.

original: ma mo brgyad kyis zhes pa ni goo r'i la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: ma mo brgyad kyis zhes pa ni goo r'i la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The eight mothers are Gaurƒ´ and so forth.

original: yang dag par mchod par bya zhes pa ni nam mkha' la gnas pa'i sangs rgyas @241b rnams la mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par mchod par bya zhes pa ni nam mkha' la gnas pa'i sangs rgyas @241b rnams la mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings means one should make offerings to the Buddhas located in space.

original: bslang zhes pa ni de rnams la gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslang zhes pa ni de rnams la gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
translated: One should arouse them means one should supplicate them.

original: de nyid gsungs pa aa bhi shi nytsa tu mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa aa bhi shi nytsa tu mam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is stated: Abhisincatu mam and so forth.

original: he ru ka'i gzugs kyis zhes pa ni he ru ka'i gzugs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: he ru ka'i gzugs kyis zhes pa ni he ru ka'i gzugs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: With the form of Heruka means endowed with the form of Heruka.

original: dbang bskur bas zhes pa ni bdun pa'i don la dang po'o //üîΩspyi bor rang gi rigs kyi bdag por 'gyur //
analyzed: dbang bskur bas zhes pa ni bdun pa'i don la dang po'o // spyi bor rang gi rigs kyi bdag por 'gyur //

original: zhes pa ni spyi bor mi bskyod pa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni spyi bor mi bskyod pa bskyed par bya'o //
translated: On the crown, one's own clan lord means one should generate Akshobhya on the crown.

original: rdzogs pa ni dbang bskur bas mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa ni dbang bskur bas mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: Completion means reaching the end by consecration.

original: des na gsungs pa /
analyzed: des na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'di yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This and so forth.

original: thun gsum du zhes pa ni mtshams gsum la'o //
analyzed: thun gsum du zhes pa ni mtshams gsum la'o //

original: byin gyis brlabs par bsgom zhes pa ni nang bar gyi thun mtshams la rim gyis bskyed do //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs par bsgom zhes pa ni nang bar gyi thun mtshams la rim gyis bskyed do //

original: nyi ma'i gung dang srod kyi mtshams su dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i bdag nyid du skad cig gis bskyed la /
analyzed: nyi ma'i gung dang srod kyi mtshams su dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i bdag nyid du skad cig gis bskyed la /
translated: At noon and the junction of dusk, generate instantly in the nature of Hevajra.

original: lhag par dmigs nas dbang bskur bar bsgom pa ni byin gyis brlabs par bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: lhag par dmigs nas dbang bskur bar bsgom pa ni byin gyis brlabs par bsgom pa ste /
translated: Meditate on the consecration means visualizing the excess and meditating on the consecration.üîΩThat should be done.

original: de bya'o // langs te zhes pa ni langs nas su'o //
analyzed: de bya'o // langs te zhes pa ni langs nas su'o //
translated: Having risen means having risen.

original: ci bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci bya snyam pa la /
translated: What should be done?

original: lha'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: lha'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The ‚Äúdivine‚Äù and so on are stated.üîΩüîΩ

original: lha ni rang gi lha ste /üîΩde nyid kyi gzugs su'o //
analyzed: lha ni rang gi lha ste / de nyid kyi gzugs su'o //
translated: The god is one's own deity.

original: skad cig so so la yang de'i lhag par mos par bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig so so la yang de'i lhag par mos par bya'o //
translated: In the form of that very deity, one should imagine oneself in every moment.

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i dka' 'grel mu tig phreng ba las lha dbang bskur ba'i le'u ste bzhi pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i dka' 'grel mu tig phreng ba las lha dbang bskur ba'i le'u ste bzhi pa'i bshad pa'o /

original: // / de ltar thun mtshams rnams su mnyam par gzhag pa dang / thun mtshams kyi bar rnams su mnyam par ma gzhag pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor gnyis bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar thun mtshams rnams su mnyam par gzhag pa dang / thun mtshams kyi bar rnams su mnyam par ma gzhag pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor gnyis bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the two yogas of the deity in equipoise and in the intervals between sessions,

original: de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi rnal 'byor brjod par bya ste /
translated: now the yoga of reality should be explained.

original: gang gi phyir gsum po med na shin tu myur bar byang chub pa med do ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsum po med na shin tu myur bar byang chub pa med do ;
translated: Because without the three, there is no very quick enlightenment.

original: / de bas na de kho na nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / de bas na de kho na nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said reality and so on.

original: de kho na nyid gsal bar byed pa'i le'u ni de kho na nyid kyi le'u'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid gsal bar byed pa'i le'u ni de kho na nyid kyi le'u'o //
translated: The chapter that illuminates reality is the reality chapter.

original: gzugs ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Form is blue, yellow, and so on.

original: de med pa ni yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: That non-existence is not existence.

original: ji ltar med ce na rang bzhin gyis te /
analyzed: ji ltar med ce na rang bzhin gyis te /
translated: How is it non-existent? By its intrinsic reality.

original: gang de'i rang bzhin gyis pas brtags zhing mthong bas gzung ba'i dngos por gyur pa de med de /
analyzed: gang de'i rang bzhin gyis pas brtags zhing mthong bas gzung ba'i dngos por gyur pa de med de /
translated: That which is imagined and seen by its intrinsic reality as an entity to be grasped does not exist,

original: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas so //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas so //
translated: because it is devoid of the intrinsic reality of one and many.

original: byis pa rnams kyi blo 'khrul ba 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyi blo 'khrul ba 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: It is only the error of the minds of fools.

original: yod pa ma yin par de dang de'i rnam par snang ba ni rmi lam la sogs pa na gzugs med kyang gzugs 'ba' zhig tu snang ba bzhin @242a * //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin par de dang de'i rnam par snang ba ni rmi lam la sogs pa na gzugs med kyang gzugs 'ba' zhig tu snang ba bzhin @242a * //
translated: The appearance of that and that form, although non-existent, is like the appearance of form alone in dreams and so on, although there is no form.

original: no ; / blta ba yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: no ; / blta ba yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And seeing does not exist.

original: de bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: blta ba med pa zhes pa ste mig la sogs pa'i blta ba dang / blta ba po skyes bu gnyi ga yang rang bzhin gyis med de /
analyzed: blta ba med pa zhes pa ste mig la sogs pa'i blta ba dang / blta ba po skyes bu gnyi ga yang rang bzhin gyis med de /
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no seeing,‚Äù because the seeing of the eye and so on and the person who sees are both intrinsically non-existent.

original: gang 'dis dngos bo'i rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa byis pa rnams kyis brtags pa de med do ;
analyzed: gang 'dis dngos bo'i rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa byis pa rnams kyis brtags pa de med do ;
translated: That which is imagined by fools as grasping the intrinsic reality of entities does not exist.

original: ; de ltar rig pa yang med pa dang / reg pa po yang med de 'dis ni skye mched bcu po gzugs dang mig la sogs pa dang / blta ba po la sogs pa'i gang zag kyang med par gsungs so //
analyzed: ; de ltar rig pa yang med pa dang / reg pa po yang med de 'dis ni skye mched bcu po gzugs dang mig la sogs pa dang / blta ba po la sogs pa'i gang zag kyang med par gsungs so //
translated: Thus, there is no cognition, and there is no one who is in contact. This is saying that the ten sense-spheres, such as form and the eye, and the person who sees, etc., do not exist.

original: sems med ces pa ni rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems te /
analyzed: sems med ces pa ni rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems te /
translated: As for ‚Äúno mind,‚Äù it is the mind that has the characteristic of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes par byed pas na rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes par byed pas na rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
translated: Consciousness is the six collections of consciousness because it is that which is conscious.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas ji srid yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas ji srid yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: It is from the eye consciousness element up to the mind consciousness element.

original: 'di rnams nyid 'das ma thag pa ni yid kyi khams so //
analyzed: 'di rnams nyid 'das ma thag pa ni yid kyi khams so //
translated: These very [six collections of consciousness] immediately past are the mind element.

original: bdun po 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa'i khams te yid kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: bdun po 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa'i khams te yid kyi skye mched do //
translated: These seven are the consciousness element, which is the mind sense-sphere.

original: gang yang rnam par shes pa drug po rnams kyis rnam par shes par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang rnam par shes pa drug po rnams kyis rnam par shes par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Also, consciousness is that which is cognized by the six collections of consciousness.

original: de bas na de yang sems kyi sgrar gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na de yang sems kyi sgrar gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is also called the term ‚Äúmind.‚Äù

original: 'dzin par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de gnyis ka yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de gnyis ka yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Both of these characteristics of apprehending do not exist.

original: gzung ba'i rang bzhin med pas 'dzin par byed pa med de /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rang bzhin med pas 'dzin par byed pa med de /
translated: Since there is no nature of the apprehended, there is no apprehender.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: Why is that?

original: gzung ba gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang 'bral ba med pas so //
analyzed: gzung ba gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang 'bral ba med pas so //
translated: Because the apprehended is free from the nature of being one or many.

original: skye mched bcu cha shas dang bcas pa rnams dang / cha shas med na yang rdul phra rab tsam du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye mched bcu cha shas dang bcas pa rnams dang / cha shas med na yang rdul phra rab tsam du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: The ten sense-spheres are either with parts, or without parts, but are still just the size of an atom.

original: rags par snang ba ni mi rigs pas gtan tshigs de ni grub tu chug na chos kyi skye mched kyi rdzas gang yin pa go cha shas dang bral bas de rnams la so sor snang ba'i rang bzhin du grub pa la gtan tshigs de ma grub ste /
analyzed: rags par snang ba ni mi rigs pas gtan tshigs de ni grub tu chug na chos kyi skye mched kyi rdzas gang yin pa go cha shas dang bral bas de rnams la so sor snang ba'i rang bzhin du grub pa la gtan tshigs de ma grub ste /
translated: Since it is illogical that they appear as coarse, if that reason is accepted, then the reason is not established for the substances of the sense-sphere of mental objects, which are free from parts, and which are established as the nature of appearing individually.

original: de'i phyir chos kyi skye mched med pa ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kyi skye mched med pa ma yin no snyam na /
translated: Therefore, the sense-sphere of mental objects does not exist.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, in order to respond to that, it is said:

original: sems las byung ba med ces pa ni sems kyi yul sems las byung ba'i chos kyi skye mched de /
analyzed: sems las byung ba med ces pa ni sems kyi yul sems las byung ba'i chos kyi skye mched de /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthere are no mental factors‚Äù means that there is no mental object, that is, no mental factor that is a sense base.

original: de yang med de ;
analyzed: de yang med de ;
translated: ‚ÄúThere are no mental factors‚Äù means that the mental object sense base, which is a mental factor, does not exist.

original: skad gcig ma ma yin pa rnams ni gzhan dag tu bzlog zin la /üîΩskad cig ma rnams kyang gzung bar bya ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: skad gcig ma ma yin pa rnams ni gzhan dag tu bzlog zin la / skad cig ma rnams kyang gzung bar bya ba mi rigs te /
translated: That is because those that are not momentary have already been refuted elsewhere.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams med pas so //üîΩda ltar byung ba rnams la byed pa med de /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams med pas so // da ltar byung ba rnams la byed pa med de /
translated: And it is illogical that momentary objects are apprehended because past and future objects do not exist.

original: yul gyi mtshan nyid ni byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gyi mtshan nyid ni byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And present objects do not function because the characteristic of an object is to function.

original: gal te de'i tshe gnyis kyi @242b tshul gyis skye mched bcu gnyis dang gang zag kyang yod pa ma yin na gang gi tshul gyis yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe gnyis kyi @242b tshul gyis skye mched bcu gnyis dang gang zag kyang yod pa ma yin na gang gi tshul gyis yod ce na /
translated: If at that time the twelve sense bases and the person do not exist in the manner of the two, in what manner do they exist?

original: gnyis su snang ba dang ldan pa 'khrul pa'i tshul gyis rdzas su yod de /
analyzed: gnyis su snang ba dang ldan pa 'khrul pa'i tshul gyis rdzas su yod de /
translated: They substantially exist in the manner of error that possesses the appearance of duality.

original: des na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid de /
analyzed: des na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid de /
translated: Therefore they are dependent origination.

original: de yang 'dir gnyis kyi tshul gyis stong pa nyid gsal ba tsam dang rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyis thams cad du ro gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dir gnyis kyi tshul gyis stong pa nyid gsal ba tsam dang rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyis thams cad du ro gcig pa'o //
translated: Moreover, here, by the method of the two, it is the mere manifestation of emptiness and mere awareness that are the same taste in all.

original: de sna 'di rnams don dam pa nyid du yod pa ste /
analyzed: de sna 'di rnams don dam pa nyid du yod pa ste /
translated: These nostrils exist in the ultimate.

original: gang gi phyir dam pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes yin la don ni de'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dam pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes yin la don ni de'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the ultimate is supramundane wisdom and the object is its object.

original: des na gnyis kyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i tshul gyis yod pa ma yin no zhes yongs su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: des na gnyis kyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i tshul gyis yod pa ma yin no zhes yongs su shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should understand that they do not exist by the method of being subsumed by the two.

original: de dag yod pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa ni nyes pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: de dag yod pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa ni nyes pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba nyid yin pas so //
translated: Because the manifest clinging to their existence is the root of all faults.

original: gnyis su snang ba dang ldan pa 'khrul ba'i rang bzhin rab tu spang par bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis su snang ba dang ldan pa 'khrul ba'i rang bzhin rab tu spang par bya ste /
translated: The appearance of duality, which is the nature of error, should be abandoned.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni 'khrul ba'i bar du dbye ba nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni 'khrul ba'i bar du dbye ba nyid yin pas so //
translated: Because the root of all suffering is the division into error.

original: gnyis pos stong pa'i rang bzhin ni mngon sum du bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis pos stong pa'i rang bzhin ni mngon sum du bya ste /
translated: The nature that is empty of the two should be actualized.

original: de mngon sum du byas pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes 'khrul ba thams cad kyi gnyen po nyid yin pas rim gyis bde ba chen po'i thar pa chen pos sangs rgyas kyi yon tan ma lus pa dbang du byed pa nyid sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi
analyzed: de mngon sum du byas pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes 'khrul ba thams cad kyi gnyen po nyid yin pas rim gyis bde ba chen po'i thar pa chen pos sangs rgyas kyi yon tan ma lus pa dbang du byed pa nyid sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi
translated: Since the direct realization of that is the antidote to all error, it gradually brings about the mastery of all the qualities of a Buddha through the great liberation of great bliss.
